items.title: Intellexa’s Predator spyware used to hack iPhone of journalist in Angola, research says

items.summary: Jack Altman and Benchmark announced today that he would be joining the firm as a general partner.

items.title: Ford turns to F1 and bounties to build a $30,000 electric truck

items.summary: A combination of 3D-printed Lego-like parts, Formula 1 thinking, and a bounty program will help the company hit that target. The team, led by Tesla veteran Alan Clarke, is obsessed with efficiency.

items.title: Meta’s own research found parental supervision doesn’t really help curb teens’ compulsive social media use
items.title_zh: Meta自己的研究发现，父母的监督并不能真正帮助遏制青少年对社交媒体的强迫性使用
items.summary: An internal research study at Meta found that parental supervision may not help teens regulate their social media, and teens with trauma are more inclined to overuse social media.

While Meta has long been using Nvidia's hardware for its AI products, this deal "represents the first large-scale Nvidia Grace-only deployment," which Nvidia says will deliver "significant performance-per-watt improvements in [Meta's] […]

items.title: Stephen Colbert says CBS banned him from airing this James Talarico interview

During his opening monologue on Monday night, Colbert says the network's lawyers told him in "no uncertain terms" that he couldn't have Talarico on the show, forcing him to post the interview on […]

items.summary: Google says it will now display links more prominently inside its AI-powered features in Search. Robby Stein, the vice president of Google Search, announced on Tuesday that a list of links will now appear inside a pop-up when you hover over the sources in AI Overviews and AI Mode on desktop, alongside a description of […]

items.title: Sony’s WH-1000XM6 are nearly $100 off for just a few more hours

items.title: Piggyback’s fantastic Metroid Prime art book is nearly 20 percent off

items.summary: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond launched on the Nintendo Switch and Switch 2 in December, but if you’re itching for some more lore, Metroid Prime 1–3: A Visual Retrospective is a nice way to dig in, especially now that it’s on sale. Normally $49.99, you can currently buy the hardcover version for $41.08 (about $9 off) […]

In an announcement on Tuesday, Google says it will share the "latest AI breakthroughs and updates in products across the company, from Gemini to Android and more" during the event, which will take place in-person in Mountain View, California's Shoreline Amphitheatre, and […]

Each has its own pros and cons, but the introduction of Apple’s newest wearables also means there are now more Apple Watch models on the market than ever before — and a lot […]

items.title: Now Pixel 9 phones can transfer files with AirDrop, too
items.title_zh: 现在， Pixel 9手机也可以使用AirDrop传输文件
items.summary: When Google announced it had engineered AirDrop compatibility for its Pixel 10 phones late last year, the pessimists among us figured it would be a matter of days before Apple shut it down. But not only is it still working, Google has expanded the capability to the Pixel 9 series (minus the budget-oriented Pixel 9A). […]

items.title: Apple is reportedly planning to launch AI-powered glasses, a pendant, and AirPods
items.title_zh: 据报道，苹果计划推出人工智能眼镜、吊坠和AirPods
items.summary: Apple is pushing ahead with plans to launch its first pair of smart glasses, along with an AI-powered pendant and camera-equipped AirPods, according to a report from Bloomberg's Mark Gurman. The three devices come with built-in cameras and will connect to the iPhone, allowing Siri to use "visual context to carry out actions," Bloomberg reports. […]

items.title: Véspera da apuração no RJ tem troca de indiretas, pressão e indício de racha no poder do Carnaval
items.title_zh: 在RJ调查的前夕，有间接的信息，压力和嘉年华的力量裂缝的证据交换
items.summary: O último dia de desfiles do Grupo Especial do Rio de Janeiro, véspera da apuração, é marcado por recados públicos e pressão nos bastidores à Liesa (Liga Independente das Escolas de Samba) e aos jurados. Leia mais (02/17/2026 - 23h24)

items.title: Taís Araujo diz que interrompeu ensaios de peça para poder curtir Carnaval na Sapucaí
items.title_zh: Taís Araujo说她打断了排练，在Sapucaí享受狂欢节
items.summary: Em preparação para estrear a peça "Mudando de Pele" em abril, Taís Araujo conta que teve de negociar com a diretora Yara de Novaes para poder dar um tempo dos ensaios durante o Carnaval. Leia mais (02/17/2026 - 23h20)

items.title: O pouco que vi, achei lindo diz Wanessa Camargo sobre desfile em homenagem a Lula
items.title_zh: 我看到的很少，我发现很漂亮， Wanessa Camargo说为了纪念卢拉而游行
items.summary: Wanessa Camargo chegou toda animada e estilosa ao terceiro e último dia de desfiles do Carnaval carioca. Leia mais (02/17/2026 - 23h03)

items.title: Fundo do pré-sal tem papel limitado na distribuição de riqueza do petróleo
items.title_zh: 盐前基金在石油财富分配中的作用有限
items.summary: Quinze anos depois da lei que instituiu o Fundo Social do Pré-Sal (FS), a atuação do mecanismo no desenvolvimento social e na redução de desigualdades no Brasil foi prejudicada em razão da falta de governança. Leia mais (02/17/2026 - 23h00)

items.title: Ex-presidente do BRB pede à PF para depor novamente no caso Master
items.title_zh: BRB前总裁要求PF在Master案件中再次作证
items.summary: O ex-presidente do BRB (Banco de Brasília) Paulo Henrique Costa tem mantido conversas com a Polícia Federal e já pediu para depor novamente no caso que apura fraudes envolvendo o Master e o banco público do Distrito Federal. Leia mais (02/17/2026 - 23h00)

items.title: Mudança em atribuições de cargos do INSS gera insatisfação e receio de fila maior
items.title_zh: INSS职位分配的变化会产生对更长队列的不满和恐惧
items.summary: Uma mudança na atribuição de cargos do INSS (Instituto Nacional do Seguro Social) proposta pelo presidente do órgão, Gilberto Waller Jr., gerou a insatisfação de parte dos servidores e o receio de que a medida possa atrapalhar os esforços de redução da fila de segurados à espera de benefícios. Leia mais (02/17/2026 - 23h00)

items.title: Exceções ao arcabouço fiscal para custear máquina pública crescem e ameaçam controle de gastos
items.title_zh: 为公共机构提供资金的财政框架的例外情况增长并威胁支出控制
items.summary: As exceções ao arcabouço para custeio da máquina pública aumentaram com a decisão do ministro do STF (Supremo Tribunal Federal) Alexandre de Moraes de excluir verbas do Ministério Público da União do limite da regra fiscal. O volume crescente de despesas que ficam fora do teto ameaça o controle das contas públicas e colabora para um maior endividamento do país. Leia mais (02/17/2026 - 23h00)

items.title: STF precisa fechar a delegacia
items.title_zh: STF需要日期来代理
items.summary: Uma série de circunstâncias jogou o Supremo Tribunal Federal no olho de um furacão político que só amainou depois que os responsáveis pela trama golpista de 2022/2023 foram encarcerados. Nessa crise, escreveu uma de suas melhores páginas. Destacou-se nessa sucessão de episódios a figura do ministro Alexandre de Moraes. Leia mais (02/17/2026 - 23h00)

items.title: Aliados de Flávio dizem que desfile de Lula foi tiro no pé; petistas veem sucesso
items.title_zh: 弗拉维奥的盟友说，卢拉的游行被击中脚部； PT支持者看到成功
items.summary: Aliados de Flávio Bolsonaro (PL) avaliam que o desfile em homenagem a Lula (PT), no Carnaval do Rio de Janeiro, deu munição aos adversários ao satirizar a parcela conservadora e evangélica da população. Para eles, foi um tiro no pé que vem sendo explorado nas redes bolsonaristas, especialmente a ala que usou uma fantasia de família em lata de conserva. Leia mais (02/17/2026 - 23h00)

items.title: Deputados são pouco engajados em pauta da igualdade racial, diz estudo
items.title_zh: 研究表明，代表们很少参与种族平等的议程
items.summary: A pauta da igualdade racial mobiliza pouco os deputados federais, segundo levantamento que avaliou mais de 37 mil ações legislativas envolvendo 571 parlamentares que estão ou já passaram pela Câmara. Leia mais (02/17/2026 - 23h00)

Jesse Jackson dies at 84 — Civil rights icon, MLK protégé, and two-time presidential candidate dies Tuesday morning surrounded by family in Chicago; Trump calls him “a force of nature”; public commemorations to be held in Chicago; nation mourns amid politically charged moment 2 […]

items.title: Chile’s Deficit Hits Post-Pandemic High as Kast Inherits a $13 Billion Gap
items.title_zh: 由于KAST继承了130亿美元的差距，智利的赤字在疫情后创下新高
items.summary: Key Points ▸ Chile’s structural deficit jumped to 3.6% of GDP (~$13.2 billion) in 2025, the highest outside a crisis and triple the 1.1% target ▸ Non-mining tax revenue hit its lowest level since 2014, while public spending grew 3.5% — marking the third consecutive year the government missed its own fiscal rule ▸ President-elect […]

items.title: EU Keeps Panama on Tax Haven Blacklist
items.title_zh: 欧盟将巴拿马列入避税天堂黑名单
items.summary: Key Points ▸ The EU Council updated its blacklist on Tuesday, keeping Panama among 10 non-cooperative tax jurisdictions alongside Russia, Guam, and Vanuatu ▸ Vietnam and Turks and Caicos were added; Fiji, Samoa, and Trinidad and Tobago were removed for meeting international standards ▸ Panama’s territorial tax system — which exempts foreign-sourced income — remains […]

items.title: Qatar’s PM Arrives in Venezuela as Doha’s Role Deepens
items.title_zh: 随着多哈角色的加深，卡塔尔总理抵达委内瑞拉
items.summary: Key Points ▸ Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman al-Thani landed in Caracas on Tuesday — the highest-ranking foreign leader to visit since Maduro’s capture in January ▸ Qatar holds the bank accounts where $500 million (~2.6 billion Qatari riyals) in US-facilitated Venezuelan oil revenues have been deposited ▸ The visit comes days after acting president Delcy […]

items.title: Latin America Hits 477 Million Air Passengers as Brazil and Argentina Soar
items.title_zh: 随着巴西和阿根廷的飙升，拉丁美洲的航空旅客人数达到4.77亿
items.summary: Key Points ▸ Air traffic across Latin America and the Caribbean reached 477.3 million passengers in 2025, up 3.8% — with 84% of growth coming from intraregional routes ▸ Brazil broke its all-time record at 129.6 million passengers, surpassing 100 million domestic travelers for the first time in history ▸ Argentina led growth at 13.2%, […]

items.title: Why Colombia’s 2026 Elections Could Turn Deadly
items.title_zh: 哥伦比亚2026年大选为何会致命
items.summary: Key Points ▸ A presidential candidate was assassinated, a senator’s bodyguards killed, and a congresswoman kidnapped — the worst political violence in over three decades ▸ The MOE watchdog counts 170 at-risk municipalities, a 30% jump from 2022, with 81 in “extreme risk” ahead of the March 8 congressional vote ▸ Investment has fallen to […]

items.title: The Best Colonial Cities to Visit in Latin America
items.title_zh: 拉丁美洲最值得一游的殖民城市
items.summary: Key Points ▸ Latin America and the Caribbean hold 143 UNESCO World Heritage Sites — Mexico alone has 37 — and 40% now report tourism-linked threats to conservation ▸ Tourism generates nearly 10% of regional GDP and sustains over 35 million jobs, turning historic preservation into an economic imperative as much as a cultural one […]

items.title: Colombia’s Investment Falls to a Two-Decade Low
items.title_zh: 哥伦比亚的投资跌至二十年来的最低点
items.summary: Key Points ▸ Gross fixed capital formation fell to 16% of GDP in 2025 — down from 24.1% in 2007 and far below the pre-pandemic average of 22% ▸ GDP grew 2.6% in 2025, below market expectations, with investment contracting 2.9% in Q4 while government spending rose 7.1% ▸ President Petro blames high interest rates; […]

items.title_zh: 成千上万的亚齐洪水撤离人员从紧急帐篷中欢迎斋月
items.summary: Panji Akbar, another evacuee in Aceh Tamiang, said he fears this year’s Ramadan will be far less peaceful than in previous years.

items.title: Dwarka car accident: Accused’s father breaks silence 'says very sorry, regretful, was not in Delhi'
items.title_zh: 德瓦卡车祸：被告的父亲打破沉默'说非常抱歉，遗憾，不在德里'
items.summary: A grieving mother is demanding an underage driver be tried as an adult and stricter action against his father after her son's death. The father expressed regret but claimed he wasn't present during the accident. The case echoes a 2016 incident, reigniting debates on parental responsibility for minors driving high-end vehicles.

items.title: Hate speech PIL 'targets' BJP CMs: Supreme Court
items.title_zh: 仇恨言论PIL “针对” BJP CM ：最高法院

items.title: YouTube down: Thousands globally facing issues with streaming videos
items.title_zh: YouTube倒闭：全球数千人面临流媒体视频问题
items.summary: YouTube is experiencing a widespread global outage, with thousands of users reporting issues loading videos on both the app and website. Problems include video playback failure, login issues, and streaming interruptions. Backend server configuration errors are suspected as the cause, though YouTube has not yet provided an official explanation.

items.title: Bengaluru bank employee dies after being hit by speeding bike; CCTV footage emerges
items.title_zh: 班加罗尔银行员工被超速自行车撞死；闭路电视录像出现
items.summary: A 27-year-old bank employee, Yogeshwari, tragically lost her life after being struck by a speeding Bullet motorcycle while crossing a road in Rajajinagar. The accident occurred during her lunch break as she was returning with a food packet. The biker, a student, also sustained severe head injuries and is undergoing treatment.

items.title: ‘Warship can be sent to sea floor’: Khamenei’s warning to US — can Iran sink US aircraft carriers?

items.summary: India and France are deepening their strategic ties with a new helicopter assembly line in Karnataka and a potential multi-billion dollar Rafale jet deal. Prime Minister Modi highlighted the nations' shared trust and commitment to manufacturing and exporting advanced technology.

items.title: Two ducks, no worries! Abhishek Sharma 'has his plans sorted'
items.title_zh: 两只鸭子，不用担心！ Abhishek Sharma “已经解决了他的计划”
items.summary: Despite two ducks in the T20 World Cup, India's team management is backing opener Abhishek Sharma's approach, emphasizing his clear plans and mindset. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak stated that the high-risk nature of T20 means players will get out, and the focus remains on his form and clarity, not just the recent lean run.

items.title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
items.title_zh: 最值得购买的股票：今天的股票推荐-检查清单

The expert shares a detailed outlook on each stock along with target prices:

items.title: Elon Musk replies to ‘internal email’ where he asked Nvidia CEO for early unit of its supercomputer
items.title_zh: 埃隆·马斯克（ Elon Musk ）回复了“内部电子邮件” ，他向英伟达（ Nvidia ）首席执行官询问了其超级计算机的早期
items.summary: A 2016 email exchange between Elon Musk and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, revealed in a 2026 trial document, shows Musk requesting early units of Nvidia's revolutionary DGX-1 AI supercomputer for OpenAI. Huang confirmed OpenAI would receive one of the first machines, crucial for developing early AI models that led to ChatGPT.

items.title: "Not Charity, But A Right": Court On Maintenance For Estranged Wife
items.title_zh: “不是慈善，而是权利” ：法院关于疏远妻子的赡养费
items.summary: The Andhra court has affirmed that awarding maintenance to an estranged wife is not charity but a right.

items.title_zh: “全球秩序正在发生变化，现在正前往漫长的暮光之城” ： S Jaishankar
items.summary: S Jaishankar said Long-standing assumptions and expectations have now become questionable.

items.summary: According to local residents, the pit has been left open for over a month.

items.summary: The 45-year-old man, who was allegedly severely beaten up by some people, succumbed to his injuries.

items.title: 札幌 白石区で落雪 雪の中から3人救助も男性1人意識なし
items.title_zh: 三人从札幌白石区落雪中获救，一人昏迷
items.summary: 18日午前、札幌市白石区の建物で落雪があり、消防によりますと、雪の中から3人が救助されましたが、男性1人が意識がない状態で病院に搬送されたということです。

items.title: 特別国会召集 午後首相指名選挙 第2次高市内閣発足へ
items.title_zh: 地铁2号线（地铁2号线）
items.summary: 先の衆議院選挙を受けた特別国会が18日召集されました。高市総理大臣は、午後、衆参両院の本会議で第105代の総理大臣に選出される運びで、今夜、第2次高市内閣が発足する見通しです。

items.title: 中央道でバス炎上 乗客は外に避難 けが人なし 東京 日野
items.title_zh: 中央路上燃烧的公交车乘客撤离无人受伤东京日野
items.summary: 18日午前、東京・日野市付近の中央自動車道でバスが炎上し、乗客が外に避難しました。今のところけが人はいないということで、警視庁が詳しい状況を調べています。

items.title: 【地震速報】鹿児島 十島村で震度3 津波の心配なし
items.title_zh: 【地震警告】无需担心鹿儿岛丰岛村地震强度为3级的海啸
items.summary: 18日午前11時28分ごろ、鹿児島県十島村で震度3の揺れを観測する地震がありました。この地震による津波の心配はありません。

items.title: 80兆円規模の対米投資“第1弾を選定”トランプ大統領が発表
items.title_zh: 特朗普总统宣布对美投资80万亿日元“入选第一轮”
items.summary: アメリカのトランプ大統領は、17日、SNSへの投稿で、先の日米合意に基づく日本からアメリカへの80兆円規模の投資や融資などをめぐって、石油・ガス事業や重要鉱物事業など3つのプロジェクトを第1弾に選定したと発表しました。

items.title: フィギュア女子SP 17歳の中井亜美がトップ 坂本花織は2位
items.title_zh: 图女性SP 17岁Ami Nakai在Sakamoto Hanawori排名第二
items.summary: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケートは女子シングル前半のショートプログラムが行われ、初出場で17歳の中井亜美選手が大技の「トリプルアクセル」を鮮やかに決めるなど自己ベストをマークする演技でトップに立ちました。エースの坂本花織選手は2位、千葉百音選手は4位につけ、日本勢3人が好スタートを切っています。

items.title: スピードスケート女子パシュート 日本が銅 3大会連続のメダル
items.title_zh: 连续三届铜牌赛速滑女子追逐日本奖牌
items.summary: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スピードスケートの女子団体パシュートは3位決定戦が行われ、日本はアメリカに勝ち銅メダルを獲得しました。日本はこの種目3大会連続のメダル獲得となりました。また今大会で日本が獲得したメダルが合わせて19個となり、過去最多の前回・北京大会を上回りました。

items.title: So you had a bowl of tteokguk during Korea’s Lunar New Year? Calories and sodium decoded
items.title_zh: 所以你在韩国农历新年期间喝了一碗tteokguk ？卡路里和钠解码
items.summary: Click here for more articles by Kormedi.com. Tteokguk, or rice cake soup, is a Lunar New Year staple often seen as a light meal but its calories are surprisingly high. Model Han Hye-jin, known for maintaining a top physique in her 40s, has long said on TV and her personal channels, “When I eat soup-based foods, I focus on the solids and leave most of the broth.” Han has explained that she consciously reduces sodium intake, especially before shoots or photo sessions. Even when she eats soups or stews, she minimizes the broth. The reason, she said, is that salty foods can lead to facial puffiness and weight fluctuations the next day. During holidays, when oily and strongly seasoned dishes such as pan-fried foods, meat and noodles are already abundant, finishing the soup broth can sharply raise total calorie and sodium intake. Many people report noticeable weight gain after the holiday period. Why tteokguk is likened to ‘two bowls of rice’ A typical bowl of tteokguk (about 150 to 200 grams of rice cakes with beef garnish) is estimated at roughly 600 to 700 calories. Rice cakes are re

items.title: Court to deliver verdict Thursday in Yoon’s insurrection trial
items.title_zh: 法院将于周四对Yoon的叛乱审判作出判决
items.summary: A court is scheduled to deliver its verdict at 3 p.m. Thursday in former President Yoon Suk Yeol’s insurrection trial stemming from his declaration of martial law, a case in which prosecutors have sought the death penalty. The ruling comes 443 days after Yoon abruptly declared emergency martial law on Dec. 3, 2024, a move that lasted about six hours before the National Assembly voted to overturn it. Yoon was indicted in January 2025 on charges of leading an insurrection and was removed from office in April that year. The ousted president faces four separate criminal trials related to the martial law fiasco, but this case — centered on the insurrection charge — is widely seen as the one most directly linked to the declaration itself. At the final hearing on Jan. 13, the special counsel urged the court to impose the harshest sentence available — death. Prosecutors argued that the martial law imposition was a long-planned attempt to dismantle the constitutional order through the mobilization of military and police forces. Armed troops were deployed to the Assembly in an attempt to d

items.title: Highways jammed as people return home on final day of Lunar New Year holiday
items.title_zh: 农历新年假期的最后一天，人们回家时高速公路堵塞
items.summary: Major expressways nationwide were congested Wednesday, as people returned home on the final day of the Lunar New Year holiday. The nation marked the major holiday, known as Seol, the previous day, with the holiday period beginning over the weekend and running through Wednesday. On some sections of the Gyeongbu Expressway, which links Seoul to the southeastern city of Busan through major cities, cars were often at a standstill as of Wednesday morning due to heavy traffic. As of 8 a.m., travel times to Seoul were estimated at 5 hours and 20 minutes from Busan, 4 hours and 20 minutes from the southeastern city of Daegu, and 2 hours and 20 minutes from the central city of Daejeon, according to the Korea Expressway Corp. (KEC). The KEC said inbound traffic was expected to peak at around 3 to 4 p.m. and begin easing at 11 p.m. A total of 4.85 million vehicles were forecast to move across the country Wednesday, including 350,000 leaving the Seoul metropolitan area for other provinces and 490,000 heading toward Seoul from other regions.

items.title: Critical Mass cyclists take back Seoul's streets
items.title_zh: 关键的群众自行车骑行者夺回首尔的街道
items.summary: A group of Korean and foreign cycle enthusiasts gathered at Sinyongsan Garo Park in central Seoul on a cold but sunny Jan. 17 afternoon. Even though it was the middle of winter, about 30 showed up for the 14th Critical Mass in Seoul to ride through the city's busy central core. Critical Mass is a monthly bicycle ride held in hundreds of cities worldwide to promote cycling, protest car-centric infrastructure and advocate for safer, more sustainable urban mobility. Previously, Seoul had Critical Mass gatherings going back to about 2001, but there had been nothing since the COVID-19 pandemic until 2024, when Kim Eui-ho and fellow cyclists discussed bringing it back. They began organizing monthly rides, inviting anyone willing to pedal through the city together. Today, they say they are the only active Critical Mass group in Seoul. Kim is the co-founder of Gridy, a bicycle messenger service. He explained to The Korea Times that the goal is the same as any other Critical Mass in the world. “However, one point that may differ from other cities is that Seoul has an extremely low population of

items.title: Russians lead asylum applications in S. Korea for 3rd year in 2025
items.title_zh: 2025年，俄罗斯人连续第三年在韩国主导庇护申请
items.summary: Russians made up the largest share of asylum seekers in South Korea for the third consecutive year in 2025 amid the war in Ukraine, justice ministry data showed Wednesday. According to the annual data of asylum seekers, 2,026 Russians applied for refugee status in the country last year, accounting for 13.8 percent of the total 14,626 applicants, followed by 1,462 Indians and 1,216 Kazakhs. The 2025 tally marked a sharp drop from 4,546 Russian applicants the previous year, but Russians have held the largest share of asylum seekers by nationality since 2023. In 2023, Russia recorded 5,750 applicants — a fivefold increase from a year earlier — in the wake of Moscow's invasion of Ukraine in early 2022. A ministry official said the conflict is believed to have had an influence on the number of Russian applications, noting the country's conscription efforts due to the war. But no Russians were granted refugee status last year, the official said. South Korea granted the status to 135 people, including 75 Burmese in 2025 alone. South Korea signed the U.N. Refugee Convention and Protocol in 199

items.title: Grand Mufti extends Ramadan greetings to Saudi leadership and all Muslims
items.title_zh: 大穆夫提向沙特领导人和所有穆斯林致以斋月问候
items.summary: RIYADH — Saudi Grand Mufti, Chairman of the Council of Senior Scholars, and Head of the General Presidency of Scholarly Research and Ifta Sheikh Saleh Al-Fawzan extended his greetings to Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques King Salman and Crown Prince and Prime Minister Mohammed bin Salman on the advent of the blessed month of Ramadan.In a statement marking the occasion, the Grand Mufti prayed to Almighty God to make this Ramadan a month of goodness, blessings, honor, and strength, and to allow it to return to the Islamic Ummah while it enjoys security, faith, stability, and prosperity. He also prayed that Muslims be granted success in fasting and performing night prayers and that their righteous deeds be accepted.The Grand Mufti urged Muslims to increase their righteous acts during the holy month, including prayer, zakat, charity, acts of kindness, recitation of the Holy Qur’an, prescribed supplications, and remembrance of Allah. He further cautioned against sins and wrongdoing, calling on Muslims to remain mindful of Allah throughout Ramadan, the month of goodness, righteousness, and piety.

items.title: Saudi Arabia, Kazakhstan establish Coordination Council
items.title_zh: 沙特阿拉伯、哈萨克斯坦成立协调委员会
items.summary: RIYADH — Saudi Minister of Energy Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman and Minister of Foreign Affairs Prince Faisal bin Farhan met with Kazakhstan’s Energy Minister Yerlan Akkenzhenov and Foreign Minister Yermek Kosherbayev in Riyadh on Tuesday. During the meeting, they reviewed oil market developments and bilateral relations across various fields.Following the meeting, Saudi Minister of Energy and Kazakhstan’s Foreign Minister signed an agreement between the two governments to establish the Saudi-Kazakh Coordination Council. The two sides affirmed that the establishment of the council reflects the directives of the two countries’ leaderships and underscored their shared desire to strengthen bilateral relations. This is through the exchange of expertise and the promotion of investment opportunities and cooperation in priority projects within the framework of the friendly bilateral relations founded on mutual trust and respect.The council aimed to enhance bilateral coordination and consultation on matters of common interest across all fields. It also seeks to further consolidate existing multi-sector cooperation by providing an effective mechanism to elevate bilateral collaboration to higher levels in a manner that serves their common interests.Both sides agreed to hold periodic meetings of the council and to establish implementation mechanisms to follow up on its outcomes, contributing to the achievement of its objectives and the strengthening of cooperation across various sectors.

items.title: On eve of Ramadan, King Salman prays for world peace and prosperity of people
items.title_zh: 在斋月前夕，萨勒曼国王为世界和平与人民的繁荣祈祷
items.summary: RIYADH — Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques King Salman prayed to God Almighty to grant peace, prosperity and stability to the people of Palestine, the Muslim Ummah, as well as to the entire world on the occasion of Ramadan. “We ask God Almighty to bless us in this virtuous month, to accept our good deeds, and to perpetuate security and prosperity in our country,” the King said in his address to Saudi citizens, expatriates, and Muslims across Saudi Arabia and around the world on the occasion of the holy month of Ramadan 1447 AH. On behalf of the King, the speech was delivered by Minister of Media Salman Al-Dossary. “We wish to congratulate you on the advent of the blessed Ramadan, a month in which the gates of Paradise are opened and which contains a night better than a thousand months. We ask God Almighty to assist us in fasting, praying, and performing acts of worship,” the King said. “We praise God Almighty for bestowing upon our blessed country the honor of serving the Two Holy Mosques and their visitors, including Hajj and Umrah pilgrims. We will continue, with God's help, on this steadfast path established by the leaders of this nation,” he said. Addressing Muslims, the King said: “The month of Ramadan is a magnificent occasion for purifying souls, performing righteous deeds, strengthening compassion and solidarity, and thanking God Almighty for His visible and unseen blessings.”

items.title: Municipalities Ministry carries out over 3,400 inspection tours in Makkah ahead of Ramadan
items.title_zh: 市政部在斋月之前在麦加进行了超过3,400次考察之旅
items.summary: MAKKAH — The Ministry of Municipalities and Housing announced the completion of 3,474 inspection tours in Makkah as part of its preparations for the Ramadan and Umrah season of 1447 AH. The ministry’s inspection teams carried out the inspections through the Holy Makkah Municipality. The inspection tours covered food establishments and commercial activities to verify compliance with health and municipal regulations and enforce measures against violators, thereby enhancing food safety and service quality.As part of efforts to raise the readiness of catering services, more than 370 kitchens were certified in accordance with the highest approved health standards, within an integrated inspection system that ensures regulatory compliance and achieves advanced levels of food safety during the holy month. The ministry affirmed the continuation of round-the-clock field inspections in line with the level of activity in Makkah, ensuring the safety of worshipers and residents during the Umrah season in Ramadan.

items.title: Saudi Mission to UN hosts high-level panel discussion on International Humanitarian Law
items.title_zh: 沙特驻联合国代表团主办国际人道主义法高级别小组讨论会
items.summary: GENEVA — The Permanent Mission of Saudi Arabia to the United Nations in Geneva, in partnership with the International Committee of the Red Cross, organized a high-level panel discussion on International Humanitarian Law. Chairman of the Board of Directors of the King Faisal Center for Research and Islamic Studies Prince Turki Al-Faisal attended the discussion. The event was held within the framework of Saudi Arabia’s leading role as co-chair of Track Three of the Global Initiative to Galvanize Political Commitment to International Humanitarian Law (IHL), focusing on "reducing suffering and promoting peace: a humanitarian perspective on disarmament.” The event reflects Saudi Arabia’s commitment to supporting international efforts to enhance respect for IHL, integrate the humanitarian dimension into disarmament discussions, and promote international peace and security.Addressing the session, Prince Turki reviewed the growing challenges facing the international system amid declining respect for international law, including IHL, and the resulting escalation of conflicts and suffering among civilians. He emphasized the importance of upholding the rule of international law as a fundamental pillar for achieving peace and stability, warning that replacing the force of law with the force of power undermines international stability and fuels impunity. He also highlighted Saudi Arabia’s firm commitment to IHL, rooted in the values of Islamic Shariah, which call for mercy, justice, and the preservation of human dignity even during armed conflicts. He pointed to the Kingdom’s active role in supporting and strengthening the IHL framework through its early accession to the Geneva conventions, participation in the Global Initiative to Galvanize Political Commitment to IHL, and co-chairing Track Three, which connects IHL to peacebuilding efforts. Organizing this high-level event builds on the mission’s efforts to reinforce the Kingdom’s active presence and engagement with international organizations in Geneva, advance international discussions on IHL, and translate the Kingdom’s humanitarian orientation into practical initiatives in the multilateral arena, reflecting its steadfast commitment to supporting international peace and stability.

items.title: Diriyah governor receives officials and university leaders following royal appointment
items.title_zh: Diriyah州长在皇室任命后接待官员和大学领导人
items.summary: RIYADH — Diriyah Governor Prince Rakan bin Salman received a number of officials and institutional leaders in his office on Tuesday, who congratulated him on the royal order appointing him as governor of Diriyah.Prince Rakan received Diriyah Company Group CEO Jerry Inzerillo and members of the Diriyah Gate Development Authority, who extended their congratulations on the occasion of his appointment.During the meeting, he was briefed on Diriyah’s ongoing projects and future plans aimed at strengthening the governorate’s position as a global destination for culture, heritage and tourism.He underscored the importance of coordinated efforts and teamwork to fulfill the leadership’s aspirations.At the conclusion of the meeting, the governor received a commemorative gift marking the occasion.In a separate meeting, Prince Rakan received Dr. Zaid Al-Zamil, chairman of the Board of Directors of Knowledge University, along with Dr. Abdulrahman bin Abdullah Al-Sagheer, president of the university, and a number of university officials, who also offered their congratulations.He also met with acting President of King Saud University Dr. Ali Masmali, who congratulated him on his appointment.The meeting included discussions on areas of cooperation between the governorate and the university and ways to enhance partnership efforts to support development initiatives, scientific research and community service in Diriyah.In addition, Prince Rakan received Director General of Education in Riyadh Region Dr. Naif Al-Zarae, who extended his congratulations.The governor was presented with a copy of the region’s annual education report outlining key achievements and educational initiatives over the past year.On each occasion, Prince Rakan expressed his appreciation for the well-wishers and their kind sentiments, praying for success in serving the leadership and the nation.

items.title: GEA chairman launches Eid Al-Fitr 2026 Identity
items.title_zh: GEA主席推出Eid Al-Fitr 2026 Identity
items.summary: RIYADH — Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General Entertainment Authority (GEA) Advisor Turki Al-Sheikh announced on Monday the launch of the official visual identity for Eid Al-Fitr 2026.This is part of the authority’s efforts to enhance the Eid celebration experience and reinforce its atmosphere as an occasion reflecting the values of joy and social connection.The new identity reflects the spirit of Eid in the Kingdom through a rich visual design inspired by authentic festive manifestations and the accompanying inherited social customs that strengthen feelings of happiness and closeness among members of society. The identity also includes an integrated system of design elements applicable across various platforms and media, including visual patterns, icons, illustrations, and color palettes, enabling the unification of the festive appearance and enhancing the visual presence of Eid across events, initiatives, and media and promotional materials. This identity comes within GEA’s direction to develop a comprehensive celebratory experience that reflects the richness of local traditions and strengthens the presence of national and social occasions through a modern creative approach that combines authenticity and contemporary design.The identity files can be downloaded via the following link: https://gea.gov.sa/eid.

items.title: 6th edition of Riyadh Season draws 17 million visitors
items.title_zh: 第六届利雅得季节吸引了1700万游客
items.summary: RIYADH — The number of visitors to the sixth edition of the Riyadh Season has reached 17 million. This was announced by Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General Entertainment Authority (GEA) Advisor Turki Al-Sheikh. The announcement coincided with the conclusion of the season’s activities, reflecting the significant turnout and wide public engagement witnessed since its launch. Reaching 17 million visitors reflects the continued success of Riyadh Season and underscores its pivotal role in supporting Quality of Life objectives and reinforcing the Kingdom’s position on the global entertainment map, it was pointed out.Launched in October 2025, Riyadh Season delivered an integrated entertainment experience featuring diverse content across entertainment zones, theatrical productions, and major sporting events in various disciplines, including boxing, tennis, and snooker. The season also hosted international and regional concerts, in addition to interactive experiences designed to cater to various age groups within an ecosystem developed in line with the highest global standards. Season zones recorded high visitor turnout, driven by the diversity of events and experiences that enabled guests to enjoy continuously evolving offerings throughout a season filled with surprises. This contributed to strengthening Riyadh’s entertainment and tourism landscape and attracting visitors from across the Kingdom and abroad. The season was marked by an expansion in both the scale and quality of its events, alongside ongoing enhancements in organizational mechanisms and service standards, positively impacting visitor experience and satisfaction while showcasing national capabilities in organizing and managing major global events.

items.title: Ramadan begins Wednesday in Saudi Arabia after moon sighting
items.title_zh: 斋月于周三在沙特阿拉伯开始
items.summary: RIYADH — The Supreme Court announced on Tuesday evening that the crescent moon marking the beginning of Ramadan has been sighted in Saudi Arabia, confirming that the holy month will begin on Wednesday.The announcement followed reports from authorized moon sighting committees across the Kingdom, in accordance with Islamic tradition.With the confirmation, Muslims across Saudi Arabia will begin fasting at dawn on Wednesday, observing the ninth month of the Islamic lunar calendar with prayers, reflection and charitable acts.Ramadan is a period of spiritual devotion marked by daily fasting from dawn to sunset, increased worship, and community gatherings.Mosques across the Kingdom are preparing to receive worshippers for Taraweeh prayers, while authorities have finalized arrangements to ensure smooth services during the holy month.Government entities and private institutions are also set to implement adjusted working hours in line with Ramadan schedules.

items.title: Two violators deported for operating unlicensed transport activity, says TGA
items.title_zh: TGA表示，两名违规者因经营未经许可的运输活动而被驱逐出境
items.summary: RIYADH — The Transport General Authority (TGA) has arrested two foreign nationals for operating road transport activities without a valid license, known locally as “kaddad,” and applied penalties that include deportation and fines of up to SR12,000.The violations were detected by TGA inspection teams during field monitoring campaigns.Authorities confirmed that the penalties were imposed in accordance with the Land Transport Law and its executive regulations, which prohibit practicing any road transport activity without a license.The law bans soliciting passengers, calling out to them, pursuing or intercepting them, or gathering in passenger areas for the purpose of offering transport services.The authority said penalties under the law include financial fines, vehicle impoundment, and deportation of non-Saudi violators once the offense is proven.TGA stressed that unlicensed transport activities pose risks to public safety, negatively affect service quality, and undermine fair competition by harming licensed operators.The authority affirmed that it will continue field inspection campaigns across all regions of the Kingdom, in coordination with relevant entities, to ensure compliance, monitor violations, and enforce penalties without leniency.It also urged all individuals engaged in transport activities to regularize their status and obtain proper licenses through official channels, noting that regulatory frameworks aim to enhance sector efficiency, improve service quality, and strengthen safety and reliability in line with the National Transport and Logistics Strategy.
